title: ChileDataAPI: Access Chilean Economic, Demographic, Environmental, and Geopolitical Data via RESTful APIs and Curated Datasets
text: ChileDataAPI package provides unified interface access open data FINDIC API REST Countries API, focus Chile. allows users easily retrieve --date time series data financial indicators UF, UTM, Dollar, Euro, Yen, Copper price per pound, Bitcoin, IPSA index, well international metadata countries via standardized API calls. API-based functions return data tidy tibble objects, making ready immediate use data pipelines. financial indicator functions, get_chile_dollar(), get_chile_uf(), get_chile_bitcoin(), provide real-time series daily monthly values, row representing timestamped observation. makes ChileDataAPI valuable tool working economic time series data reproducible manner. addition API-access functions, package includes collection curated datasets related Chile, covering diverse topics : Demographics: sample microdata 2017 Chilean Census Elections: data 2021 presidential elections national plebiscites Public health: individual-level records national health surveys Human rights: detailed accounts violations Pinochet regime Seismology: geolocated data earthquakes Chile Geopolitical data: official territorial codes communes, provinces, regions Environmental history: tree-ring based climate series Malleco forest ChileDataAPI designed support research, teaching, data analysis focused Chile integrating public RESTful APIs high-quality, domain-specific datasets single, easy--use R package.

title: ChileDataAPI: Access Chilean Economic, Demographic, Environmental, and Geopolitical Data via RESTful APIs and Curated Datasets
text: ChileDataAPI package provides several core functions access real-time structured information Chile public APIs FINDIC REST Countries. list main functions included package: get_chile_bitcoin(): Retrieves daily Bitcoin price Chilean Pesos last month. get_chile_copper_pound(): Returns historical daily copper prices (per pound). get_chile_dollar(): Provides exchange rate U.S. Dollar CLP. get_chile_euro(): Provides exchange rate Euro CLP. get_chile_ipsa(): Retrieves daily values IPSA (Chile’s stock market index). get_chile_uf(): Returns daily values Unidad de Fomento (UF). get_chile_utm(): Returns monthly values Unidad Tributaria Mensual (UTM). get_chile_yen(): Provides exchange rate Japanese Yen CLP. get_country_info(name): Get essential information Chile country full name Example: get_country_info(“Chile”),get_country_info(“chile”),get_country_info(“Peru”) view_datasets_ChileDataAPI(): Lists curated datasets included ChileDataAPI package functions return real-time data tidy tibble format represent time series updated daily monthly depending source. functions allow users access high-quality structured information Chile, can combined tools like dplyr, tidyr, ggplot2 support wide range data analysis visualization tasks. following sections, ’ll find examples work ChileDataAPI practical scenarios.

what: Systolic Blood Pressure by Age and Gender
title: ChileDataAPI: Access Chilean Economic, Demographic, Environmental, and Geopolitical Data via RESTful APIs and Curated Datasets
code: # Clean data: remove missing values from key variables health_clean <- chile_health_survey_df %>%   filter(!is.na(age), !is.na(pas), !is.na(male))  # Create gender variable health_clean <- health_clean %>%   mutate(gender = ifelse(male == 1, "Male", "Female"))  # Plot: Systolic Blood Pressure vs Age by Gender ggplot(health_clean, aes(x = age, y = pas, color = gender)) +   geom_point(alpha = 0.4) +   geom_smooth(method = "lm", se = FALSE) +   labs(     title = "Systolic Blood Pressure (PAS) by Age and Gender",     x = "Age (years)",     y = "Systolic Blood Pressure (mm Hg)",     color = "Gender"   ) +   theme_minimal()

title: ChileDataAPI: Access Chilean Economic, Demographic, Environmental, and Geopolitical Data via RESTful APIs and Curated Datasets
text: dataset ChileDataAPI labeled suffix indicate structure type: _df: standard data frame. _ts: time series object. _tbl_df: tibble data frame object.

title: ChileDataAPI: Access Chilean Economic, Demographic, Environmental, and Geopolitical Data via RESTful APIs and Curated Datasets
text: addition API access functions, ChileDataAPI provides several curated datasets offering valuable insights Chile’s recent history, population health, territorial divisions, electoral processes, seismic activity. featured examples: census_chile_2017_df: Data frame containing microdata 2017 Chilean census, specifically commune San Pablo. dataset includes 7,512 observations, variable names data values Spanish. chile_earthquakes_tbl_df: Tibble containing information significant (perceptible) earthquakes occurred Chile January 1st, 2012 present. malleco_tree_rings_ts: Time series object (ts) containing average annual tree ring width, measured millimeters, Araucaria Araucana trees located Malleco region Chile.

title: ChileDataAPI: Access Chilean Economic, Demographic, Environmental, and Geopolitical Data via RESTful APIs and Curated Datasets
text: ChileDataAPI package provides robust set tools access open data Chile RESTful APIs curated datasets. includes functions retrieve real-time financial indicators—value dollar, euro, yen, copper, UF, UTM, Bitcoin—via FINDIC API, well international country information REST Countries API. Additionally, offers preloaded datasets covering Chile’s recent history socio-political context, including 2017 census sample, 2021 presidential election, public health survey data, territorial codes, seismic events, records human rights violations Pinochet regime.

text: Renzo Caceres Rossi. Author, maintainer.

title: Access Chilean Economic, Demographic, Environmental, and Geopolitical Data via RESTful APIs and Curated Datasets
code: # Load the package  library(ChileDataAPI)  # Selected, essential information about Chile  get_country_info("Chile")  # Provides the exchange rate of the U.S. Dollar in CLP  get_chile_dollar()  # Load a dataset  data("census_chile_2017_df")  # Shows six rows of the dataset  head(census_chile_2017_df)  # Display the structure of the dataset  str(census_chile_2017_df)  # Shows the whole dataset  View(census_chile_2017_df)

what: Chilean Census Example Data (San Pablo Commune, 2017) — census_chile_2017_df
title: Chilean Census Example Data (San Pablo Commune, 2017) — census_chile_2017_df
text: dataset, census_chile_2017_df, data frame containing microdata 2017 Chilean census, specifically commune San Pablo. selected due relatively small size, making suitable inclusion CRAN GitHub repositories. dataset includes 7,512 observations 60 variables related housing, households, individuals, migration, education, geographic information. variable names data values Spanish, retrieved original source.

title: Chilean Census Example Data (San Pablo Commune, 2017) — census_chile_2017_df
Chilean Census Example Data (San Pablo Commune, 2017) — census_chile_2017_df

title: Chilean Earthquakes Data — chile_earthquakes_tbl_df
text: dataset, chile_earthquakes_tbl_df, tibble containing information significant (perceptible) earthquakes occurred Chile January 1st, 2012 present. data originally compiled Centro Sismológico Nacional (Chile) published Kaggle Nicolás González Muñoz. dataset includes 4,018 observations 5 variables, capturing relevant geophysical characteristics date time occurrence, geographic coordinates, depth, magnitude seismic event.

title: Chilean Earthquakes Data — chile_earthquakes_tbl_df
Chilean Earthquakes Data — chile_earthquakes_tbl_df
text: tibble 4,018 observations 5 variables: Date(UTC) Timestamp earthquake UTC (POSIXct) Latitude Latitude coordinate event (numeric) Longitude Longitude coordinate event (numeric) Depth Depth kilometers (numeric) Magnitude Richter magnitude earthquake (numeric)

title: Chilean Earthquakes Data — chile_earthquakes_tbl_df

Variable names values English, originally provided source.

what: Chilean 2021 First Round Presidential Election — chile_election_2021_df
title: Chilean 2021 First Round Presidential Election — chile_election_2021_df
text: dataset, chile_election_2021_df, data frame containing results first round 2021 Chilean presidential elections. includes vote counts seven presidential candidates, well counts blank null votes. observation corresponds individual ballot box, identified unique ID associated electoral district. Additionally, dataset includes demographic information age distribution voters ballot box, logical indicator mismatches inconsistencies vote counts.

title: Chilean 2021 First Round Presidential Election — chile_election_2021_df
Chilean 2021 First Round Presidential Election — chile_election_2021_df
text: data frame 46,606 observations 21 variables: REGION Administrative region (character) ELECTORAL.DISTRICT Electoral district (character) BALLOT.BOX Unique identifier ballot box (character) C1 Votes Candidate 1 (integer) C2 Votes Candidate 2 (integer) C3 Votes Candidate 3 (integer) C4 Votes Candidate 4 (integer) C5 Votes Candidate 5 (integer) C6 Votes Candidate 6 (integer) C7 Votes Candidate 7 (integer) BLANK.VOTES Count blank votes (integer) NULL.VOTES Count null votes (integer) X18.19 Voters aged 18–19 (integer) X20.29 Voters aged 20–29 (integer) X30.39 Voters aged 30–39 (integer) X40.49 Voters aged 40–49 (integer) X50.59 Voters aged 50–59 (integer) X60.69 Voters aged 60–69 (integer) X70.79 Voters aged 70–79 (integer) X80. Voters aged 80 older (integer) MISMATCH Logical indicator inconsistency vote reporting (logical)

what: Voting Intentions in the 1988 Chilean Plebiscite — chile_plebiscite_df
title: Voting Intentions in the 1988 Chilean Plebiscite — chile_plebiscite_df
text: dataset, chile_plebiscite_df, data frame containing information voting intentions 1988 Chilean plebiscite. data collected national survey conducted FLACSO/Chile April May 1988. dataset consists 2,700 observations 8 variables, including demographic details region, sex, age, education, income, well voting preferences support status quo. observations contain missing values.

title: Voting Intentions in the 1988 Chilean Plebiscite — chile_plebiscite_df
Voting Intentions in the 1988 Chilean Plebiscite — chile_plebiscite_df
text: data frame 2,700 observations 8 variables: region Region respondent (factor 5 levels: "C", "M", "N", "S", ...) population Population size respondent's area (integer) sex Sex respondent (factor: "F", "M") age Age years (integer) education Education level (factor 3 levels: "P", "PS", "S") income Income respondent (integer) statusquo Support status quo (numeric scale) vote Intended vote (factor 4 levels)

what: Get Observed Bitcoin Value from the findic.cl API — get_chile_bitcoin
title: Get Observed Bitcoin Value from the findic.cl API — get_chile_bitcoin
text: function retrieves observed value Bitcoin US Dollars API endpoint: https://findic.cl/api/bitcoin. data provided Chilean website findic.cl.

title: Get Observed Bitcoin Value from the findic.cl API — get_chile_bitcoin
Get Observed Bitcoin Value from the findic.cl API — get_chile_bitcoin
text: tibble (data frame) following columns: fecha: Fecha del valor observado (en formato "YYYY-MM-DD"). valor: Valor del bitcoin en dólares estadounidenses (numérico).

title: Get Observed Bitcoin Value from the findic.cl API — get_chile_bitcoin
text: values returned API include metadata time series daily values. names variables values Spanish, exactly provided API. example, result includes columns named fecha (date) valor (value). function sends GET request /api/bitcoin endpoint. request successful (HTTP 200), parses JSON response extracts time series data key serie. names values kept Spanish provided API translation modification applied.

title: Get Observed Bitcoin Value from the findic.cl API — get_chile_bitcoin
text: Requires internet connection. function returns values exactly provided Spanish.

title: Get Observed Bitcoin Value from the findic.cl API — get_chile_bitcoin

what: Get Key Country Information from the REST Countries API — get_country_info
title: Get Key Country Information from the REST Countries API — get_country_info
text: Retrieves selected, essential information Chile country full name. data retrieved REST Countries API. See API documentation https://restcountries.com/. Example API usage: https://restcountries.com/v3.1/name/chile?fullText=true.

title: Get Key Country Information from the REST Countries API — get_country_info
Get Key Country Information from the REST Countries API — get_country_info
text: name Full country name (common official). example: "Chile", "Peru", "France".

title: Get Key Country Information from the REST Countries API — get_country_info
text: data frame 8 columns: name_common: Common name country. name_official: Official name country. capital: Capital city. region: Geographic region. subregion: Subregion. population: Total population. area: Total area square kilometers. languages: Official languages, separated commas.

title: Get Key Country Information from the REST Countries API — get_country_info
text: function returns readable details country's common official name, capital, region, subregion, population, area, official languages. function sends GET request REST Countries API. request successful (HTTP 200), parses JSON extracts key fields. country found error, function returns NULL user-friendly message.

title: Get Key Country Information from the REST Countries API — get_country_info
